column4: Hi, everyone. I'm using the Wubi installer on a raid 0 system and am getting an error that states the root filesystem isn't defined.
Anyone have a solution to this?
er, 8 GB ram I mean
So, does anyone have a solution to the root file system error on a wubi install?
Anyone here familiar with Wubi at all?
That was kinda rude
you might have an NTFS error. Sorry, I don't know the debugging, that's a Windows filesystem it sits on
I set up a laptop for work with wubi, and had a problem with my filesystem. I had to reinstall -- lost what I had, which was no big deal for me.
partitioning is a good thing. If I wanted to run Wubi again I'd give it it's own D: drive
you change any entries in the Windows boot loader? It sounds like an entry in there is pointing to something moved or nonexistent
it's an entry that Wubi puts in itself
yes, it makes an entry in there.
that's what I'm saying
Using a RAID 0

that makes me suspect an NTFS error even more. You may want to run fsck or chkdsk or scandisk or whatever can check errors on the filesystem. RAID0 can introduce errors, though normal Windows usage can too.
that's the basics. I've re-created the raid and even reinstalled win just to see if it'd have any affect
reinstalling windows and rebuilding the raid must have wiped out the wubi file -- or did you restore it?
I reinstalled wubi AFTER the fact, yes.
what would the next approach be?
like I said, check the filesystem. Or commit to a reinstall.
it's been done already and still no juice
